review_content:
This is such a great product... In theory... I returned this (Diabolique) within 72 hrs of receiving it and instead got "Beloved", which was a SLIGHT improvement.. This is just a *huge* no. Both of them settled into the fine lines in my lips on application, caused my lips to chap more, it wipes off almost completely if you do anything with your mouth (rubbing your lips together, adding chapstick under/over, drinking/eating, dabbing your lips, transfers easy, etc.). The same applies for the cheek wear. (You're better off buying a mini from Milk Makeup). I thought it would be worth the money, it isn't. If you want to spend this much for a subtle color, go with YSL sheer lip. I would not ever recommend this for ANYONE.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I’ll start off by saying I love RMS products. I own almost every different product they have in their line. I have the shades Diabolique, Spell, Beloved, and Demure in the Lip2Cheek’s. Diabolique is by far my favorite. All the shades are luminous without being overly oily. I tend not to like dual lip and cheek products. I think most I have tried looks great on the cheeks but is drying on the lips. I’m not sure how they created such a great product but it works no matter where I put it. All shades I have tried are easy to blend and wear well, even for my oily skin. You can wear them sheer or really build up some intense color. I use a lot of rms products every day and it works beautifully with the new foundation or even on bare skin. They also play nicely with other foundations I own. It doesn’t slide around my face or move my foundation around under where I place the blush.

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Gray', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Color Spell for Seriously Pale Dry Skin
review_content:
Finally. Truly healthy makeup! I research all my ingredients and this formula is not only healthy for your skin, but Spell is the perfect go to color for me. I get called Casper at times due to being pale but I hate makeup that gives you a tan or is an unnatural color. If you have cool undertones and your skin looks pink or reddish, you will love this color. I use it on cheeks, lips, and eyelids for a perfect no makeup look. Trick for this brand if you have dry skin. Apply 2-3 drops of your favorite Argan, Jojoba, or Marula Oil 2-3 minutes over moisturizer or spf before applying this brand to prevent any caking or dry spots. LOVE!!!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: gorgeous colour and product, but didn’t work out
review_content:
I honestly ADORE this colour - it’s like a baby-pink and I didn’t even notice much of the mauve undertones until I swatched it next to another pink blush I have. I definitely preferred this as a cheek product than a lippy - it just faded quick on my lips it was like a tinted balm almost. I did end up returning the product, however, because it just wasn’t compatible with my other makeup products (the formula does not hold up great apparently, as per RMS, if you have silicones or hyaluronic Acid underneath) and it faded a bit quickly unless I had no makeup on. But if you use their other products or any other “clean” products, or aren’t a foundation fan/use powder foundation even I’d say this could work for you!! I didn’t have issue applying this overtop of powder either which was great. It blends like a dream with fingers and I barely needed any product so while it’s a lot of money for the amount, I seriously see this lasting someone ages - definitely as long as any other blush product that has a larger oz. size since I literally only tapped my one finger a couple times in it and that was enough! I wish this worked out for me this time but if I ever get their un-coverup, I’d absolutely repurchase this! Also, if you have dry skin skin like myself, this brand has an awesome balance of giving your skin a fresh and hydrated look (not oily, or accentuating dry spots at all! If anything it moisturizes).

review_content:
I really like how easy this goes on and it blends pretty well. It doesn’t have any weird shimmer or glitter which is nice. It seems like a very small amount for the price, but a little does go a long way. I ordered this in 2 shades, beloved and smile. I usually wear a natural, fresh make-up look, so I didn’t want anything too over the top — more just a warm flush and glow, like how I look after a workout. I have light skin, green eyes, brown hair, and I’m in my 30s. I read the reviews saying not to be put off by the colors as they appear in the pot because they can go on the skin less intense and are buildable. They are buildable, but I would say that they aren’t all that less pigmented on the skin as they are in the pot, for me. For my skin tone, beloved was too much/too red. It didn’t look natural on me, but perhaps if you have a darker skin tone or a tan, it would be great. Smile was a better fit for me. Here’s pictures of smile (on top)

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Pigmented on cheeks and smells amazing
review_content:
I love this portable and multi-use product because it's so versatile. Like other reviewers say, it is sheer on the lips, but I like that because I can layer it, and it gives more of a natural, blurred, and tinted color. Although it may be sheer on the lips, it's definitely pigmented for the cheeks! I only have to dab it lightly and it's more than enough. I love pairing it with my simple bare makeup look which just consists of doing my brows and mascara. There's also a very light and natural coconut scent that's not overpowering and quite pleasant. It's kind of pricey for what you're getting, but I understand since it's "clean" makeup. I definitely recommend this product to my fellow beauty insiders!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Better to test colours in person
review_content:
Judging from the online swatches I thought Modest would be best for me, but it was far too coral toned (like most of the colours tbh) when I tried it in person. Illusive ended up suiting my skin tone the best (I'm fair with rosy undertones). It is very pigmented, but the intensitity can be easily controlled with application. Initially I didn't like how buttery the formula felt, but it's surprisingly not greasy or uncomfortable on the skin. I don't find this is super moisturising on the lips however - I would only use it applied over lip balm. This colour actually also looks very pretty lightly applied on the eyelids! Product is expensive, but I think it's worth it for the ingredients, quality and how long the actual product will last.

review_content:
I bought this at a store where I live and was so exited since I love the living luminizer from RMS Beauty. Unfortunately it dose not show up on my skin, regardless of the amount I use. I have a medium to olive skin tone, and when I tried this out, the summer was yet to arrive in Norway, so I had no tan on my face at al. I give it two stars since the color is beautiful. It shows up on my lips, however the color dose not look that good, and is to light for my taste on the lips.

review_content: Love this product. Goes on well, stays on much longer than ILIA's color stick. "Modest" was a touch warmer than I thought it'd be, so when I run out I'll try a slightly cooler shade of pink. Looks great on lips, too. Consistency is thickened coconut oil, but with staying and non-smearing power.

review_content: Color didn't look the same as online. A very small amount of product for a big price.

review_content:
Gorgeous coral. The red undertone keeps it from being too pink or too orange. Nars Orgasm looked very pink swatched next to Paradise. Blended easily and gave a nice healthy flush. Dried down with no tacky feel. I am very pale with pink undertones and I would say that this would be a neutral colour and flattering for all skin tones..light or deep..since it can be sheered out or built up for more intensity. The picture of the pot is a true representation of the colour ( at least on my screen)

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Love this red! It's a good balance of sheer with enough color to look almost like a stain, but still very hydrating. I primarily use this on my lips but is also good for blush. The color stays on pretty well and doesn't dry out my lips.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: Really enjoy the color In promise. Very pigmented and looks great on both lips and cheeks. It’s a mid-tone rosy color that provides more depth to your natural tones without looking unnatural. I usually blend with my fingers or a damp beauty blender on cheeks.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I purchased the shade illusive and I’m obsessed. The color is extremely flattering and adds subtle definition to the face. A little goes a very long way. The shade blends easily, dries down to a powdery finish and lasts all day!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Not sure how I feel about this product. On one hand the color looks perfect in the pot, but it’s so sheer when I apply it. It also has this strange lip balm like or salve finish to it once applied to the cheeks, it looks greasy. The color Spell is an identical match to my natural lip tone so I’m surprised that it does nothing but add moisture, so...I’m disappointed in trying this out because I hoped it was pigmented like the swatches I saw online. I think I’ll play around with this some more and see if it’s worth the price tag or not.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
LOVE this! I now have both Diabolique and Beloved. Diabolique gives my lips a wintery just-bitten look with a single layer and turns to a gorgeous burgundy with more layers. Incredible colour payoff with a tiny bit of product even on my NC40/C5 skin. Whatever is left on my finger I use on my cheeks for a nice flush. The stain left behind on my lips is true to the original colour. Beloved is a lovely bright red with a bit less colour payoff than diabolique and fades to more of a pinky-red on my lips. As a blush it gives a truly heated flush on my face, which I also like!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: most beautiful lip and cheek stain!
review_content:
I own almost every color. They have more pigment on fair skin than you might expect but they sheer out beautifully if you like more of a natural stain. They are luminous on the cheek, use the blush brush for quick, flawless application. (Great brushes for any cream products.) I love to mix the colors for variation - cannot go wrong, in my experience. For lip, also get the balm for some slip and conditioning. I like the glass pots for travel and display. I lay them upside down in my desk drawer. You do have to reapply due to the natural ingredients. But the pot is easy to carry, as mentioned. I do wish RMS designed a display/ organizer for your vanity. But she doesn’t dig plastic and I am not sure others would be down with light natural wood?

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: This was one of the first two products I tried from RMS and I fell in love. Great quality and performance. Leaves my lips with that perfect just bitten natural look. You can layer it on your lips and cheeks but I usually just do one layer patted on and blended. It’s the right amount for color that lasts all day. Don’t be fooled by the small jar. I’ve had mine for a while and I use it all the time.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: Not enough colour payoff for deep skin
review_content: So this review is actually for the colour smile which they’re not listing here... anyways smile looks great in the pot. I have warm/neatest undertones and am about a Fenty 370/390 or deep in Tarte, and this colour didn’t show up on me at all! Going to have to return sadly.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: I picked up Curious because Paradise was sold out during the VIB event. I love it! A little goes a long way and it gives me a lovely flush to my cheeks that makes my skin look healthy and glowing. I can honestly wear this a cc cream, lipstick and mascara and look really put together!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I use this as a blush, and it works really well. It blends into my skin nicely.

I tried the colour demure and loved it. It gives me a pink hue I've been searching for. I have tan/olive skin and black hair. I love RMS products for it's natural ingredients. I think you have to put enough on to gain its 'moisturizing properties' Um, yeah I would definitely repurchase.

Gorgeous color! I ordered this product in Diabolique and Modest. I LOVE the Diabolique- it's a rich, deep berry color that can go on sheer or you can build up to a deep, beautiful burgundy. It's gorgeous for fall. It looks amazing on my light/medium skin. The Modest was a little too terra-cotta for me and I was hoping for more plum. It got returned. I do love that this is a two in one product, and can go into my bag easily without getting lost. The color payoff is surprising. You can't go wrong with the Diabolique!

I have a couple pots of Lip2Cheek, and I find that they perform better as a blush than as a lip color. While the product is creamy and easy to apply, it definitely requires touch ups during the day--not too big of a deal because the little pots are super portable!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Great if you have large pores!
review_content:
At first I wasn't sure about using a cream blush since I've always stuck to powders because I have oily/combination skin but I'm so glad I gave this a try. I blend it with my finger then set my whole face/foundation with their unpowder and it lasts all day long. I also use it without setting it with powder, and on my lips on the days I run errands and I look glowy and natural. I love how versatile it is and that it has pure ingredients. I have large pores and it actually minimizes the look of pores on my cheeks, I can tell because I was using Kjaer Weiss' cream blush and that one made my pores look bigger. My skin tone is light olive, and have almost black hair and the color demure gives me a beautiful innocent youthful look. The color Curious surprisingly looks good too, like when I was a kid and went out to play outside and my cheeks got flushed from running around :-)

review_content: The color I got (modest) was more coral than I had expected. The pot makes it awkward to apply to the lips but very pretty on cheeks.
I liked the colour, but was not impressed with the quality of the container nor the product. For the price I paid, I expected a higher quality product. The colour is nice though!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: Got this in beloved and it's a beautiful color. It's so pigmented you only need to lightly tap it to pick up enough product. It's definitely my go-to 'natural look' blush that I keep in my makeup bag for on the go touch ups
I got the shade vogue rose (in the vogue x birch box) it is hard to blend on the cheek but if you use a beauty blender it looks BEAUTIFUL!! Super natural! It hydrates my lips and goes on nicely

I bought this in illusive, which is the exact neutral i was searching for (medium yellow skintone). However, the "gone bad" lipstick is hard to ignore and it doesn't seem to be one bad one because i did exchange the first one. But the second one also has tge same problem. Will not repurchase this (love the bronzer though!)

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content: I was skeptical about purchasing this since I'm 57 and have oily skin. I thought it would just melt off. But happily I am wrong! I love this so much I bought another color! Goes on silkily and stays put. A little goes a long way. Makes your blush look so natural. Love it.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content:
I wanted to love this product - the shades are lovely, its eco-friendly, and the brand has been getting a lot of buzz. Unfortunately RMS Lip2Cheek doesn't age well., Though at first its texture goes on very nicely, after about 1 month the product separates - oil gathers on the top while the rest of the product is very dry. I have two pots of Lip2Cheek and almost never use them because its so much hassle mixing the shade back to a usable texture. Won't be buying again.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content: I love the texture of this product and I really like the clean ingredient list. I just wish that it lasted longer. I think that's kind of the tradeoff when you switch to natural products. I use "beloved" and it's a nice punchy red. I like how you can build the colour nicely. Like other RMS products a little bit goes a long way!

I have spent the last six months switching over to green beauty products, after discovering that many of the ingredients used routinely in cosmetics could very well exacerbate a hormonal condition I have. RMS beauty may be my new favorite brand. This line is really for a natural, dewy, inner beauty kind of look, which isn't everyone's cup of tea, but I just love it. I have the lip2cheek in promise, which on my light, warm-toned skin is an extremely natural flush, and smile, which is brighter and more playful. I love them so much I just ordered spell, curious, and diabolique!

Creamy and not particularly long lasting on the cheeks. Very short acting on the lips. Had a bad smell like old lipstick that has been sitting around for 30 years. Will return.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: So easy to blend and use on your lips or cheeks. This is truly "on-the-go" makeup which is the PERFECT, natural pop of colour. If wish for a more matte look, simply pat with RMS Un-powder. Fav: Spell for a nude, natural look on the cheeks & lips. I am truly in a spell.
I picked up demure and it's a beautiful pink that gives just the little pop of colour I was looking for - the coverage is so light and sheet but can be built up for more intense colour

I absolutely adore Diabolique and Promise. They're the only lip colours I wear and create such an unique fresh off the runway look. Not exactly a traditional lipstick but so much more than a stain. Be warned, the gorgeous frosty glass container BREAKS, so if you want to carry it around i highly recommend transporting in a plastic container a little bit at a time. Also, the coconut oil will melt in high heat.

I had been eyeing this for so long and I was so excited when I finally ordered it, and wasn't disappointed when I received it. I bought the color diabolique, and it can be layered for a more dramatic/opaque color, but I love doing a flushed look on my lips and my cheeks. I've had it since August, and about a month in, it started drying out, and I screw the lid on completely. All I have to do is warm it up with my finger and it's fine but I expected a better lifespan for 36 dollars. Other than that, I'm 100% happy with this product! It lasts a long time, and it's so versatile. Great with sensitive skin and even better because no animals were harmed :)
